properties.areaDesc: Western Columbia River Gorge; Western Columbia River Gorge
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 1:44PM PST until January 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED IN THE OREGON COASTAL RANGES AND THE
WASHINGTON AND OREGON CASCADES INTO THURSDAY...

.A strong area of low pressure off the Pacific Northwest coast
will spread moisture inland today. A cold front will slowly move
across the inland areas this evening and tonight. Relatively low
snow levels are expected to result in moderate snow accumulations
affecting much of Southwest Washington, the Columbia River Gorge,
and the hills above 1000 to 1500 feet around Northwest Oregon
through early Thursday.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
up to 4 inches, heaviest near Cascade Locks and Stevenson. Ice
accumulations of one to two tenths of an inch. Wind gusts to 60
mph through late evening, then gradually decreasing.

* WHERE...Western Columbia River Gorge.

* WHEN...Through 10 AM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will become very difficult through the
Columbia Gorge due to snow, ice, and wind. Snow, ice, and wind
may also bring down tree branches, leading to isolated power
outages.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow today will likely transition to
freezing rain tonight, especially between Multnomah Falls and
Stevenson.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THURSDAY
